Title: NASU seeks criminalisation of non-payment of wages
Summary: The Non-Academic Staff Union of Educational and Associated Institutions (NASU) and other university-based unions will continue to engage in industrial action to protect their members’ interests and foster a conducive learning environment . The General Secretary of the union, Peter Adeyemi, seeks criminalisation of non-payment of wages .

Title: Sanwo-Olu provides N460m financial support to vulnerable residents
Summary: Lagos State Governor Babajide Sanwo-Olu disbursed N460 million in financial assistance to 1,000 vulnerable residents under the state’s Eko Cares Initiative . The governor restates his commitment to inclusive governance and social welfare .

Title: EFCC gives victim properties recovered from fake spiritualist in Ibadan
Summary: Executive Chairman of the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission, Ola Olukoyede, handed over three properties, two luxury vehicles, and the sum of ₦1.1 million to a fraud victim, Mr. Daniel Babatunde Attiogbe, following a court order .

Title: Husband killer, Maryam Sanda, removed from revised presidential pardon list
Summary: Maryam Sanda, sentenced to death in 2020 for the culpable homicide of her husband, Bilyaminu Bello, has been removed from the pardon list . President Tinubu on Wednesday ordered the removal of individuals convicted of severe crimes .

Title: NDLEA foils attempts by hoodlums to free arrested drug kingpin in Rivers
Summary: Heavy gunshots were fired in Port Harcourt, Rivers State, on Tuesday evening, October 28, 2025 . Hoodlums launched a brazen attack on officials of the National Drug Law Enforcement Agency (NDLEA) in an attempt to free an arrested drug kingpin .

Title: Kalu seeks stronger legislative–judicial synergy for justice reforms
Summary: Deputy Speaker of the House of Representatives, Hon. Benjamin Kalu, has called for collaboration between the National Assembly and the Nigerian Bar Association (NBA) to advance judicial reforms . Kalu seeks stronger legislative–judicial synergy for justice reforms .

Title: Delta Assembly passes anti-terrorism, anti-cultism bill
Summary: Delta House of Assembly passed the state’s Anti-terrorism and Anti-cultism (Amendment) Bill, 2025, for assent .

Title: Reps push for digital birth, death registration to strengthen national planning
Summary: Reps push for digital birth, death registration to strengthen national planning, social development, and security . House of Representatives has called for the adoption of a modern, technology-driven system for the registration of births, deaths, marriages, and other vital events .

Title: Aiyedatiwa lauds Tinubu’s bold, courageous reforms
Summary: Ondo State Governor, Lucky Aiyedatiwa, commends President Bola Ahmed Tinubu for his bold and transformative economic reforms . He described them as vital steps toward stabilizing Nigeria’s economy .

Title: South West must reclaim heritage of good governance — Sanwo-Olu
Summary: Babajide Sanwo-Olu urged the South West to reclaim its heritage of education, innovation, and good governance . Lagos State Governor urged the region to reclaim education and innovation . The South West Governors’ Forum is based in Lagos .

Title: AAC condemns sexist jokes, defends Anambra gov candidate's campaign photos
Summary: The African Action Congress has condemned sexist jokes and coded language directed at its governorship candidate in the upcoming Anambra elections, Chioma Ifemeludike . The party described such attacks as a distraction from substantive political discourse . The statement highlighted the deep-rooted patriarchy in Nigerian politics .

Title: Private university students also deserve NELFund, says Bowen VC
Summary: The Vice Chancellor of Bowen University, Iwo, Osun State, Prof. Jonathan Babalola, faulted the Federal Government’s exclusion of private university students from the Nigerian Education Loan Fund . He said the loans given to public university students are sourced through taxes paid by private individuals . The scheme provides interest-free loans to

Title: EFCC returns houses, luxury cars to victims of fraud in Oyo
Summary: The Economic and Financial Crimes Commission has handed over three properties, two luxury vehicles, and ₦1.1 million in cash . The properties include a five-bedroom duplex with an adjoining three-bedroom bungalow at Kasumu village, Odo-ona Elewe, Ibadan . The recovered were a grey

Title: Reps summon JAMB registrar after officials' walkout
Summary: The Joint Admissions and Matriculation Board walked out of a session convened by the House of Representatives Committee on Basic Education and Examination Bodies . The Committee, led by Bayelsa lawmaker, Oboku Oforji, had summoned the examination body to account for its 2023–2024 budget performance .

Title: Place regional development above partisan politics, Fasoranti tells S'west govs
Summary: Pa Fasoranti gave the charge at the South-West leaders’ dialogue with officials of the Federal Government, in Akure, Ondo State capital, on Wednesday . The elder statesman warned them against division along party lines at the expense of the welfare and development of the people of the region .
